EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (5.0, 0.0) with an associated Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill:
 – Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5). Initially in a NO_FUEL state, it was refueled (after harvesting coal) to work temporarily before its status updated to WAITING_FOR_SPACE_IN_DESTINATION when repositioning of the sink chest failed.
• Drill Inserter:
 – Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore from the mining drill.
• Output Sink & Extraction System:
 – Original Wooden Chest at (-14.5, -51.5) serving as the output sink.
 – Multiple attempts were made to reposition a new sink chest closer to the mining drill drop (including a temporary placement at (-11.5, -46.5) and attempted shifts to (-14.5, -48.5)), but all failed due to placement conflicts and prototype validation issues.
• Belt Network Remnants:
 – Pre-existing belt segments connecting the mining drill drop to the smelting network remain unchanged.
 – An attempted connection using a transport belt from (-14.5, -48.5) to the sink chest failed because transport belts require an intermediary inserter when targeting container entities.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Sink Chest Placement and Repositioning:
 – Verify that the target tile is free and buildable before placing a chest.
 – Use consistent and accurate prototype identifiers (for example, always "wooden-chest") to prevent prototype mismatches.
 – Ensure that all referenced entity variables are defined to avoid NameErrors.
• Fuel Insertion:
 – Check that the inventory holds sufficient fuel (coal) before attempting an insertion; harvest resources if necessary.
• Transport Belt Connections:
 – Do not connect transport belts directly to container entities; always use an inserter as the intermediary for item transfers.
• Inventory Inspection:
 – Confirm the existence of an entity at the specified coordinates before inspecting its inventory to prevent NoneType errors.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  – Invocation Note: The function was used during sink chest repositioning but failed when the entity’s prototype did not match the expected type.
Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
